title: Automatic library search is crazy!
body:
Suppose I want to link to `libsoundio`. I have a folder containing the MinGW and MSVC builds:

    libsoundio.a
    soundio.lib

In theory, I can specify linking to these files in `.cargo/config` as follows:

```
[target.i686-pc-windows-gnu.libsoundio]
rustc-link-search = ["libsoundio-1.1.0/i686"]
rustc-link-lib = [":libsoundio.a"]

[target.i686-pc-windows-msvc.libsoundio]
rustc-link-search = ["libsoundio-1.1.0/i686"]
rustc-link-lib = ["soundio.lib"]
```

The `:` is to make gcc behave sanely and not try to do automatic `lib`-prepending and all that nonsense. I don't think that is necessary on MSVC because they name libraries sensibly.

Unfortunately, as you can see in [this code](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/19a39710c494d9300ffdc4e3f40dfda0ef62f7ba/src/librustc_back/archive.rs#L57) Rust does crazy file-name mangling of its own. This is a *really* bad idea and leads to a huge confusing mess.

If I try and compile with the above files and config, I get this build error:

```
.... "libsoundio.lib" ....
  = note: LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'libsoundio.lib'
```

Ok first wtf. I definitely didn't specify `libsoundio.lib` anywhere. Ok maybe Rust automatically prepends `lib`. That's pretty stupid (what if my file doesn't start with lib?) but ok. I'll rename `soundio.lib` to `libsoundio.lib`. Rebuilding...

```
.... "libsoundio.lib" "ole32.lib" "soundio.lib.lib" ....
  = note: LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'soundio.lib.lib'
```

Ok. What. I... what do I do now? Maybe this will work?

    rustc-link-lib = ["soundio"]

```
..."libsoundio.lib" "ole32.lib" "soundio.lib"...
  = note: LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'soundio.lib'

```
So it adds `.lib` to the end? Ok I'll rename my file back to `soundio.lib`.

```
..."libsoundio.lib" "ole32.lib" "soundio.lib" ...
  = note: LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'libsoundio.lib'
```

Argh! Why is it trying to link two files?! I eventually worked out that removing the `rustc-link-lib` line entirely and naming the file `libsoundio.lib` works.

I would suggest totally removing the magic search code. People are perfectly capable of typing "lib" and it would greatly reduce confusion.
